Class FlightOrder

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.FlightOrder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class FlightOrder
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class FlightOrder ~ represents a single flight associated with a single order
    Author:
    Java Course Team 2014, University Of Haifa-Israel
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FlightOrder.FlightTicket addTicket(Customer passanger, int seat, int row, java.lang.String classType)
      The role of this method is to add a new ticket to the tickets set You need to check if the specific place {seat and row} (not by equals method) is available in this flight by checking all the flight tickets associates with this flight.

      • addTicket

        public FlightOrder.FlightTicket addTicket(Customer passanger,
                                 int seat,
                                 int row,
                                 java.lang.String classType)
        The role of this method is to add a new ticket to the tickets set You need to check if the specific place {seat and row} (not by equals method) is available in this flight by checking all the flight tickets associates with this flight. Do not forget calculate the total amount Please be aware for the return type of this method, you should use it in IFly class!
        Parameters:
        passanger -
        seat -
        row -
        classType -
        Returns:
        the flight ticket object if the ticket added successfully or null otherwise

      • removeTicket

        public boolean removeTicket(FlightOrder.FlightTicket ticket)
        The role of this method is to remove a ticket from the tickets set do not forget calculate the total amount
        Parameters:
        ticket -
        Returns:
        true if the ticket remove successfully or false otherwise
